project.description: This would be cleaner and more portable if it was a python script that check for initialization.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
assume_role(){ local role_arn=${1:-"arn:aws:iam::${app_acct_id}:role/${jenkins_provisioning_assume_role_name}"} OUTPUT=$(aws sts assume-role \ --role-arn $role_arn \ --role-session-name "teardown-rebuild" \ --query "Credentials.[AccessKeyId,SecretAccessKey,SessionToken]" \ --output text)
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=$(echo $OUTPUT | awk '{print $1}') export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=$(echo $OUTPUT | awk '{print $2}') export AWS_SESSION_TOKEN=$(echo $OUTPUT | awk '{print $3}') }
reset_role(){ unset AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID unset AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY unset AWS_SESSION_TOKEN }
export -f assume_role export -f reset_role
cd app-infrastructure
aws s3 cp s3://$stack_s3_bucket/deployment_state_metadata/${target_stack}/terraform.tfstate .
terraform init
for instance in httpd wildfly dictionary hpds; do reset_role assume_role
echo `terraform output "${instance}-ec2-id"`
INSTANCE_ID=`terraform output "${instance}-ec2-id"` echo "Instance-id is $INSTANCE_ID"
aws --region=us-east-1 ec2 describe-tags --filters "Name=resource-id,Values=${INSTANCE_ID}" while [ $(aws --region=us-east-1 ec2 describe-tags --filters "Name=resource-id,Values=${INSTANCE_ID}" | grep InitComplete | wc -l ) -eq 0 ];do echo "$instance EC2 still initializing";sleep 60;done echo "$instance EC2 Initialization Complete"
done
